name: A Simple Music Encoder
description: You have been hired by a major MP3 player manufacturer to implement a new music compression standard. In this kata you will implement the ENCODER, and its companion kata deals with the DECODER. It can be considered a harder version of Range Extraction. # Specification The input signal is represented as an array of integers. Several cases of regularities can be shortened. * A sequence of 2 or more identical numbers is shortened as ```number*count``` * A sequence of 3 or more consecutive numbers is shortened as ```first-last```. This is true for both ascending and descending order * A sequence of 3 or more numbers with the same interval is shortened as ```first-last/interval```. Note that the interval does NOT need a sign * Compression happens left to right # Examples * ```[1, 3, 4, 5, 7, 8, 9, 10, 11, 14, 15, 17, 18, 19, 20]``` is compressed to ```"1,3-5,7-11,14,15,17-20"``` * ```[0, 2, 4, 5, 7, 8, 9]``` is compressed to ```"0-4/2,5,7-9"``` * ```[0, 2, 4, 5, 7, 6, 5]``` is compressed to ```"0-4/2,5,7-5"``` * ```[0, 2, 4, 5, 7, 6, 5, 5, 5, 5, 5]``` is compressed to ```"0-4/2,5,7-5,5*4"``` # Input A non-empty array of integers # Output A string of comma-separated integers and sequence descriptors
